GameData:
-
-
The Netherworld -
The Netherworld -
Ghost -
Blessings of all the worlds upon you, noble and graceful Yuyuko Saigyouji, ghost of flawless, immaculate beauty! You are the princess of Hakugyokurou, domain of artists and seat of power in the Netherworld. Your rule is just, your people without sin, and your retainers legendary in their skill with the blade. Though others believe you a fool, your cunning struck a blow upon the egos of the Lunarians, discovered the secret behind a number of incidents, and stole away Gensokyo's spring. With over a thousand years of wisdom and absolute power over death, the mortal world trembles in your presence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gentle Yuyuko, the souls of the dead now look to you for guidance. Will you answer them? Will you once again strike awe into the land of the living? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
-
The Netherworld -
When a soul is judged by the Yama to be without such sin as to send it to Hell, it is taken instead to the Netherworld, where it is managed by the princess of Hakugyokurou and spends its time surrounded by the beauty of nature until the time comes for it to reincarnate. The Netherworld is vast and residence is especially transient, so it has few problems with maintaining its population, unlike the Hells, and much of the land is taken up by massive natural gardens, including the famed cherry blossom garden of Hakugyokurou. Travel between the Netherworld and the world of the living used to be almost impossible, but after the border between the Netherworld and Gensokyo was weakened by the princess, ghosts and youkai began to move between the two worlds at their leisure.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If the border were to collapse, and the Netherworld were to be thrust into the land of the living, Hakugyokurou's princess may be forced to shape the Netherworld into a true civilization...
-
Yuyuko Saigyouji feminine
-
Yuyuko Saigyouji -
Ghost Girl in the Netherworld Tower -
Dreaming Ghost[NEWLINE]Ghost of the Snow[NEWLINE]Enlightened Ghost -
~1000 AD -
About -
Yuyuko is the ghost princess of the Netherworld, having been in her position for over a thousand years. After being driven to suicide by her own power over death, the Yama appointed her as eternal ruler of the Netherworld, removing her from the Wheel of Life. Having forgotten the time when she was alive, she spends her days leisurely in the mansion of Hakugyokurou, occasionally going out to cause trouble out of boredom. Her personality is playful and carefree, which sometimes gives others the impression of being airheaded, but she is a cunning leader with a knack for seeing through the schemes of others. Her closest friends are Yukari Yakumo, the ancient youkai of boundaries who knew her even when she was alive, and her beleaguered half-phantom servant, Youmu Konpaku.
-
Gain Samurai Poets 60% faster, and Great Artists and Musicians 15% faster during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages. Units gain +33% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages. -
Deadly Butterfly
-
Cherry Blossom Garden -
Provides 3 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Points (GPP) towards a Samurai Poet. Add up to two specialists to this building to gain [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and increase the rate of Samurai Poet acquisition (3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 3 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] GPP per specialist). -
The cherry blossom garden of Hakugyokurou is amongst the most beautiful in all the worlds. Cherry blossom trees have long been a source of inspiration for poets and artists, and the almost 3,000 kilometer garden, hidden away in the realm of the dead, is more inspiring than most. Stretching out so far as to seem endless, and said to contain a youkai cherry blossom tree that could once tempt a human to death with its beauty, it attracts ghosts, phantoms, and even youkai from the world of the living to participate in flower viewings. -
The Cherry Blossom Garden is the unique building of the Netherworld. It provides 3 [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Points (GPP) towards a Samurai Poet instead of 1, and also provides 5 Happiness to keep the empire stable. Replaces the Writers' Guild.
-
Samurai Poet -
Powerful Unit that can attack twice in one turn and generates [ICON_CULTURE] Culture upon killing an enemy. Can also be consumed to create a Great Work of Writing. -
Japanese nobles, faced with impending death, would often compose one final tanka poem as a reflection on life and death. Many samurai, after first arriving in the Netherworld, would see the cherry blossoms of Hakugyokurou and be reminded of their death poems, becoming inspired to write further on the nature of death.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It may be that the cherry blossoms of the Netherworld are the source of its power, for with so many warriors skilled in both pen and sword, the princess of Hakugyokurou has great powers of culture and war at her command. -
The Samurai Poet is the Netherworld's unique unit, replacing the Great Writer. Although they can be used to create Great Works of Writing like normal, they are also strong warriors who can generate a lot of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on their own by going to war. Since the Netherworld produces a lot of Samurai Poets, you can use them effectively with any playstyle.
Samurai Poet
Base [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength is 30% greater than that of the strongest Melee or Gun Unit that can be trained.
-

Gyoi -

Saigyou
Certainly.
Of course.
Why, yes.
Oh, why not?
Well, okay.
Oh, yes.
Indeed.
Oh, my. Whatever did I do to provoke such violence?
Oh dear, you're finally attacking. Youmu, take care of this for me.
My, but you are a bold one. Well, I won't disappoint you if you want to fight.
You'll have to excuse me, but I think your subjects would prefer living in my realm. So, what's the quickest way to move them...?
Youmu is going to slash you now.
Sorry, but you're a little bit in my way. Don't worry, I'll treat you kindly when you're dead.
Oh, dear. And I was having so much fun playing war with you.
Youmu, we're out of a home. Build us a new one with a nice garden, okay?
Oh, my. Now who will look after all the ghosts?
I think it would be in your best interest to give me this.
I would appreciate it a lot if you could lend me some support. I'm running low on all kinds of... essential items.
Could I ask you for a small provision? Someone spent all of my budget on private banquets.
Oh, my, no.
Certainly not.
I must disagree.
Of course not.
I'm afraid not.
Not at all.
I can't agree.
Well, if it isn't someone new! I am Lady Yuyuko Saigyouji, princess of Hakugyokurou. Let's have a feast to celebrate our meeting!
Pleased to meet you. I am Yuyuko Saigyouji, and this is my gardener, Youmu. Shall we have some sake together?
My, I didn't expect a visitor today. I am Lady Yuyuko Saigyouji of Hakugyokurou. Youmu, please offer our guest some tea.
Goodbye.
Have a wonderful day!
Bye, now.
Have a pleasant day.
Show our guest out, won't you, Youmu?
Ta ta!
I hope you can find your own way out.
Hello, again. Is this business, or have you come for the party in the garden?
Hello, there. Have you come to view the cherry blossoms?
Well, hello there. Won't you join me for an early dinner?
Welcome. Will you be staying for lunch?
You're looking lively. What can I do for you?
Welcome to Hakugyokurou. Tea?
Oh, welcome. Can I help you with anything?
Is this about the unseasonal snow? I had nothing to do with it.
Oh! Let's talk over brunch.
If you're looking to hire the Prismrivers, you'll have to ask them yourself. They don't really work for me, you see.
Do you know any scary stories? I'm taking Youmu to another hundred ghost stories event, but I'm running out.
I know there's a tree in the garden that doesn't bloom. It can't be helped.
Is there a loved one you'd like to visit? I might be able to arrange it...
If you're looking to borrow my Youmu, I'm afraid her schedule is booked.
Ah, I give up. It seems we can't beat you right now.
Oh, no. We'll need much more for this deal.
I think we need more for this.
It might be fair if you offered more.
I'd love to, but I need just a little bit more.
I'm not sure this deal is good for me...
I'm afraid I just can't do that. I have to ask for more.
Youmu would be cross with me if I didn't ask for more.
I don't think that's quite fair for me, do you?
Maybe if you offered a little more...
Now, that's just not fair, is it?
I can't make that deal.
That's hardly a fair deal.
Well, I suppose that's all right with me.
A wonderful agreement.
I think that's a good deal. I accept.
I was wondering if you would agree to a trade.
I'd so like to have this. You'll trade for it, won't you?
I was wondering if you wanted to trade with me.
Oh, my. You're going to make Youmu upset.
I'm sorry, but I can't help you right now.
I don't think I can just give that away, do you?
It can't be helped. I'll send it to you now.
Of course, I'd be glad to help! I'll even throw in some... oh dear, someone's eaten it - never mind!
I don't see why I can't be a little bit charitable. I hope you make good use of it.
Oh, dear. Am I bad at bluffing?
I just remembered, it's dinner time. Let's wrap this up.
Well, it was worth a try.
Hmm. Oh, well.
Ah, doesn't it feel good to win a battle once in a while? Oh, yes, I'll leave you alone now.
-
No, really, I can't do that. -
I don't think we're getting anywhere. -
Why don't we relax under the cherry blossoms? That sounds better than arguing. -
You're back. Did you forget something? -
We have got to stop running into each other like this. -
You're back already? -
Hmm. I wonder what you came back for?
-
Hello again. Can I get you anything? -
Youmu, some sake for our guest. You take a drink, right? -
Welcome. Are you here to trade, or is this a social call? -
Why, hello. -
Welcome. Take a look around the gardens, if you like. -
Welcome to Hakugyokurou. Here for some sightseeing? -
Oh my, it's you. -
Welcome to Hakugyokurou. Pardon Youmu's manner; she doesn't like you very much. -
You've come back? I wonder what for? -
Promise me you'll spare the cherry blossoms? -
No, no, Youmu. It won't do to fight in a conference. Please, go on. -
You've come to make peace, I hope? -
I don't think this war is very productive, do you? -
Don't you think we can live together in peace? Although, I'm dead. -
Oh, hello. Sorry, I'm not ready for peace right now. -
This war business is sort of fun, isn't it? -
Hello, there. I hope the war is going well for you, too. -
Welcome. It's so much fun to work together on a Research Agreement, don't you agree? -
It isn't good to tell lies. Youmu can slash those, too. -
Ah, if it isn't our good friend! -
Do you think {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} will discover our plan? -
Youmu had some good ideas about the war with {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}. They're all sword-based, but you should have a look at them. -
I have Youmu working around the clock against {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} - three o'clock snacks are suspended until we win! -
Oh, you're here? Shouldn't you be at war or something? -
Hello, there. Is your war going well? -
Oh, my. Could you be trying to intimidate me, perhaps? -
You have an awful lot of soldiers near my border. I'm afraid they'll have to disarm before I can let them view the cherry blossoms. -
I hope you know how to use that land you're grabbing. I would hate to see you bite off more than you can chew. -
You're claiming an awful lot of land. Can you really use it all? -
You really should be careful about buying so much land. Someone might get upset. -
You must be very wealthy to afford so much land. -
You've got quite a strong military. I hope you're feeding them well. -
I'm glad to see you're doing well. Budgets are so hard to manage. -
I forgot that you were an empire, with how small you are. -
You should think about building a bigger army. Do you need Youmu to help train your troops? -
You've been quite violent lately. Do you need to de-stress? -
Oh, hello. Would you like some perfectly undoctored tea? -
Is this about the denouncement? -
Oh? You want to talk to me now? -
I think your friendship with {1_PlayerName} is admirable. They're very tolerant. -
What do you say to inviting {1_PlayerName} over for a flower viewing party? I'll bring sake. -
Do you dislike {1_PlayerName}? Or is it just political? -
I heard you share my opinion on certain people. Not that I'm that serious. -
We should get to know each other first, don't you think? -
Oh, but it's too soon for that. Let's think about it later. -
I think we should denounce {1_CivName} together. Don't you? -
{1_CivName} is in the way right now. Won't you join me against them? -
You have been very dishonest with me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
I suppose I should have seen it coming. Oh, well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
I didn't want to have to do this, but needs must. I, princess of Hakugyokurou, do formally uninvite you from our flower viewings.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Oh, dear. Are you mad about something? -
What's wrong? Are you jealous? -
Oh, you're friends with {1_CivName} now? How wonderful! We should get together sometime. -
Oh, you've made friends with {1_CivName}. Well, I won't hold it against you. -
I was going to invite you to a party with {1_PlayerName}, too... Oh, what should I do? -
{1_CivName} aren't very nice, are they? Well, as long as we agree. -
Oh, I should be friends with {1_CivName}, too. How wonderful! We should all drink and eat dumplings together! -
I suppose we agree on {1_CivName}. It is a little sad, isn't it? -
You're teaming up with {1_CivName}? My, I wonder what you could be thinking. -
Someone has to side with {1_CivName}, don't they? I suppose I will.
-
Excuse me, but you're expanding a bit close to my borders. Could I ask you to leave me some space? -
Oh, dear. You didn't mean it at all when you said you wouldn't settle near us, did you? This is going to hurt our relationship. -
I really did mean it about the land-buying. If you keep this up, it will hurt our relationship. -
Sorry to ask, but you're buying a lot of land near me. I'd like it if we could share the land. -
You promised to stop buying land near us. What can I do if you break your promise, I wonder? -
Oh, is that city-state under your protection? How rude of me. -
I have to attack one of your friends. You understand. -
Pacts of Cooperation shouldn't be possible, but here we are. -
I think it's time the two of us made a Declaration of Friendship, don't you? I'll have Youmu handle all the paperwork. -
Shall we make a Declaration of Friendship? You'll be invited to all of our flower viewings... as long as you bring food. -
I think that you are rude.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
I must condemn your recent behaviour. At least, I think that's what I should do.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Oops. -
Oops. -
Oops. -
Oops. -
Oops. -
Oops. -
Oops. -
Oops. -
I think you should join me against {1_PlayerName:textkey}. Don't you think it might be fun? -
Please join me in war against {1_PlayerName:textkey}. We simply cannot let them do as they please. -
Our preparation time is up. Shall we begin? -
Are we now past the point of forgiveness? Well, that's the way it is. -
I suppose we are enemies now. It can't be helped. -
I'm quite impressed with your empire. Won't you tell me your secret? -
I've begun to hear poems written about your civilization. It sounds like you've become quite great indeed. -
Won't you come over for a visit sometime? We'll throw a feast to celebrate your success as a leader. -
Are you feeling all right? Too much aggression can be bad for your health. Well, I don't have to worry about that. -
The leaders of {1_MinorCivName:textkey} have been coming to visit my garden less often lately. Would you happen to know why that might be the case?
-
Could you tell me your name again? I just keep forgetting. -
I'm impressed with the progressiveness of your society for electing such a... Oh, I shouldn't say that. -
Youmu, there's a barbarian there. Please slash them.[NEWLINE]...What? It's not? Oh, my mistake. -
A poorly-defended civilization is easily taken advantage of. I just thought you should know that. -
If I use these nuclear weapons, the Netherworld will get a lot busier. Should I, or shouldn't I...? -
You catch more flies with honey than with vinegar, you know. -
Your people seem so unhappy. Are you sure you don't want me to take them to a better place? -
Youmu, let's try and gain influence with that city-state.[NEWLINE]...What? It's an empire? Oh, how unfortunate. -
I tried to eat at one of your city's restaurants, but they ran out of food to serve in no time. Are you sure you're providing enough for your citizens? -
A lot of your citizens have been coming to view the cherry blossoms lately. They're so awestruck every time, it's as if they have no culture of their own.
-
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} announces to the world that it is now protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. Attacking the City-State will greatly damage relations and may lead to war. -
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
-
No. -
Very well. It would be inappropriate of me to take your land from you. -
Oh, I can't agree to that. There are so many ghosts coming in all the time, and I have to make sure they can live somewhere nice. In a manner of speaking. -
I accept. Youmu, pour some sake. Let's drink to our new alliance! -
I am afraid I must decline. -
Oh, no. I can't do that. -
Oops. -
How can I turn down an invitation like that? Let's get started. -
Hmm... Give us ten turns to get ready, and I'll have Youmu put together a war effort. -
Well, if you insist. -
Oh, dear. I suppose it can't be helped; I'll give you what you want. -
Oh? Don't you normally raise an army before demanding something like that? -
I'm sorry, but I simply cannot just give you something like that. Not even out of pity. -
Your jokes are in poor taste. -
Oh, I can't part with that much. You should demand something more reasonable. -
I'm sorry, I'm no good at haggling. Can't you just make a reasonable demand first? -
I'm afraid the answer is still no. -
If you ask twice, I say no twice. Then three, four, and five thousand eight hundred seventy three times.
-
... -
I'm tired of fighting. May we have peace now? -
I think it's time we stopped the violence. -
If you don't mind, I'd like to have something of yours. If you do mind, I'd like it anyway. -
Might I trouble you for this? -
Since we're such good friends, I got you a gift. No need to get me anything in return. -
Might we open our borders to one another? It's so much easier to import exotic foods that way. -
Can we make a Research Agreement later?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Agreeing will not form a Research Agreement yet) -
Let's make a Research Agreement together. I'm sure I have some scientists floating around the place. -
Let's renew this deal, shall we? I think it's good for us both. -
I'm afraid I have to ask for more in order to keep this deal going.
-
That's very generous of you. I happily accept. -
Oh, my. I can't say no to that deal. -
I'm pleased that we could come to this agreement. -
That sounds fair. -
I humbly accept. -
I think that looks fair. Pleasure doing business with you. -
I knew I could count on your wisdom. -
Excellent. You may stand down, Youmu. -
You're quite gracious. I accept your apology. -
Oh, no. I must ask for more. -
Well, that just isn't fair at all. -
I cannot accept. -
I'm afraid that just isn't reasonable. -
I can't possibly accept that deal. -
We don't need to change it, do we? -
It looks perfectly fair to me. Don't you agree, Youmu? -
What do you think about this? -
I think this would be fair. -
Oh, I don't think I can make a deal for that. -
That's unfair from the start, isn't it?
-
Oh, my. I think I owe Youmu some money now. -
An ambush? How rude. -
Oh, dear. Do I look weak to you? -
How unfortunate. I should have expected this. -
You're quite bold, aren't you? I think this will be fun. -
Youmu, someone is attacking us. I'll be in the tea room. -
Oh, my. What should I do about this? -
You can't enter the Netherworld if you commit suicide. Was that your intention? -
Oh, my. This will be fun. -
You want to play war with me? How novel! I accept. -
Is there anything more beautiful than danmaku amidst the cherry blossoms? -
Did you think I didn't see this coming? This will be a fun game. -
It makes me happy that we can get together and play games like this every now and then. Youmu, please crush them. -
Oh, dear. I truly expected more from you. -
Did you have to do that? I'm highly disappointed. -
We could have stayed friends, you know. Well, not that I didn't see this coming.
-
I have a great idea! Let's go to war. -
Shall we dance in the falling danmaku together? -
I think I will have Youmu teach you a lesson. -
Liars should be punished, shouldn't they? -
There's no more space in the Netherworld. People just don't stop dying. -
I'm out of land. Could I borrow some of yours? -
Your life -[NEWLINE]How much more of it remains?[NEWLINE]The night is brief. -
Oh, I just can't help myself. Your empire is like a big dumpling without anyone around to guard it! -
You really should be defending your lands. Otherwise, this happens. -
Whatever should I do now? I suppose this is my only option. -
Ah, I think I'm losing. I might as well fight then, right? -
Excuse me, but could you please die? -
It's quite relaxing in the Netherworld, isn't it? I'll do you a favour and make you a permanent resident. -
Your protection was appreciated, but I never liked you that much. -
I'm terribly sorry, but I must fight you now. -
Ah, I wish I didn't have to do this. -
Perhaps I was too subtle with my demand.
-
By all means, state your terms. -
What do you have to offer? -
Please, make an offer. -
I think that works wonderfully. -
How nice. Well then, Youmu, you can stop now. -
Oh, but I'm having so much fun. -
Oh, no. We can't do that right now. -
Now? But we've only just begun.
-
How nice. -
Oh, Youmu, isn't that nice? -
Excellent. -
Thank you. -
I appreciate it. -
My thanks. -
What a shame. -
Hmm. How disappointing. -
Oh, dear. -
I suppose it can't be helped. -
If that's the way it has to be. -
That is how it will be, then. -
Thank you for returning my workers. I always get in trouble when ghosts get out. -
Grabbing my land? That won't win you any favours. -
I'm glad you are at least honest about it. -
Then by all means, pass on. -
Well, at least you are honest about it. -
In that case, feel free. Just be careful, okay? -
I suppose we'll both have to live with that. Well, you will. I'm dead. -
Well then, it's all fine now. -
I understand your feelings, but I hope you will look past it. -
I can't say I didn't anticipate that. -
Unfortunately, that means we cannot be friends. -
Well then, the matter is put to rest. -
Well then, the matter is put to rest. -
Well then, the matter is put to rest. -
Well then, the matter is put to rest. -
Well then, the matter is put to rest. -
It's so much fun having nuclear weapons. Everyone is so polite to me now!
-
You're following Freedom, too? How nice. -
I see you've adopted Order. I'm glad we agree on that. -
Autocracy is such a convenient way to rule, isn't it? I think it was a good choice. -
Youmu caught one of your people in my garden the other night. Do you have anything to say for yourself? -
If you want to view the cherry blossoms, you should come to the garden openly. Youmu slashes people who sneak about. -
Well, I'm glad that's settled. -
That's unfortunate. Well, not for Youmu. She likes slashing. -
Very well. I'll send my ghosts elsewhere. -
Oh, but I can't. My ghosts protect me from everyone, including you. -
Thank you for your warning. I shall have some choice words for the {@1_CivAdjective} leader. -
I happen to know that {1_PlayerName} is plotting against you. You'll share any more gossip you hear with me, won't you? -
I happen to know that {1_PlayerName} is planning to attack {2_CityName}. You'll share any more gossip you hear with me, won't you? -
I happen to know that {1_PlayerName} is planning to attack you. You'll share any more gossip you hear with me, won't you? -
I happen to know that {1_PlayerName} is planning to attack {2_CityName} by sea. You'll share any more gossip you hear with me, won't you? -
I happen to know that {1_PlayerName} is planning to attack you by sea. You'll share any more gossip you hear with me, won't you? -
Youmu slashed someone in the garden, and it turns out they were your spy. I'll take care of them if they end up here as a ghost, but really shouldn't have been here in the first place, should they? -
I hope you'll forgive my spying. I was just playing a little game. -
Ah, you caught me. -
Would you happen to know where our scientists went? It wasn't time for them to reincarnate, and they took all of their research with them. -
Could I ask you to stop converting my people? It's confusing to hear someone preaching in the afterlife. -
Such bold words. Well, I understand how you feel. -
I appreciate your understanding. -
Thank you for your understanding. -
I see. That is unfortunate. -
Very well. I wouldn't want to overstep my bounds. -
And why should I do that, I wonder? Your people seem to prefer my religion. -
Have you come to surrender? -
Ah, are you getting bored? Do you want to surrender now?
-
Oh? And how are you going to stop me? -
I'm glad we understand one another. -
Well, I suppose I can understand your feelings. -
I'm glad you can overlook my indiscretion. -
Oh, dear. I don't think I have anything that could match that. -
Hmm... I'm not sure. What do you think it's worth?
I'm quite pleased with your proposal to the {1_LeagueName}. Let's have a toast to our mutual interest!
That was a very interesting proposal you made to the {1_LeagueName}. Is there something you want to tell me?
I'm pleased by your support of our proposal to the {1_LeagueName} Shall we drink to our mutual interest?
I appreciate your support of our proposal to the {1_LeagueName}. It's so good to have friends, isn't it?
While I understand why you might have opposed our proposal to the {1_LeagueName}, such contrarianism won't lead anywhere good for either of us.
I'm disappointed by your opposition to our proposal to the {1_LeagueName}. Surely we can be above petty rivalry.
I'm thankful for your vote for us to host the next World Congress. By working together, the world will be made a little bit more beautiful.
You're digging in my territory. Could I ask you to stop?
But what if I find something fun? I can't stop now.
Ah, I thought I could get some nice-looking artifacts. I'll leave them for you, then.
Oh, my. Such defiance over something like this.
I'm pleased we can get along like this.
It seems that I have a resistance on my hands. Do they really think Freedom will solve their problems? Once you're dead, you can only be here or in Hell.
I thought "socialism" meant "have more parties," but it appears that what my people really want is Order. You really shouldn't be putting such ideas in their heads.
Are you aware that my people are calling for Autocracy? Being Supreme Leader sounds like too much work... I wonder if Youmu can do it instead.
It looks as though your people are unhappy without the Freedom of the Netherworld. What a shame that they had to witness it before they died, and know that there was something better.
It looks as though your people are unhappy without the Order of the Netherworld. What a shame that they had to witness it before they died, and know that there was something better.
It looks as though your people are unhappy without the stability provided by the Autocracy of the Netherworld. What a shame that they had to witness it before they died, and know that there was something better..
I see you've made the decision to free your people. Isn't it so much better when we can all be nice to each other?
I see you've made the decision to stop exploiting your people. Isn't it so much better when we can all work together?
I see you've made the decision to provide firm guidance to your people. Isn't it so much better to rule without restrictions?
Oh, dear. No one's coming to visit the gardens anymore, and they're all listening to your pop music and wearing your blue jeans. I just hope kimonos never go out of fashion.
The Netherworld is so lively all of a sudden. So many people are coming from the outside! I'm happy that your people can appreciate the beauty of cherry blossoms and poetry.
- -
